page_title: Heart Pump Testing Services | Synchrony Labs
hero_description: Comprehensive preclinical validation for mechanical circulatory support devices with pump performance characterization, hemocompatibility assessment, durability protocols, and hemodynamic testing under physiological conditions using GLP-compliant methodologies.
primary_content_description:
Mechanical circulatory support devices sustain life by generating continuous flow, requiring validation that demonstrates reliable pump performance while preventing blood damage and thrombotic complications. Heart pumps must maintain 5 liters per minute across varying preload and afterload conditions while operating continuously for months or years without mechanical failure. Continuous-flow platforms demand specialized shear stress assessment while pulsatile systems require complex timing validation and chamber pressurization characterization.

We evaluate pump performance using pressure-flow curve analysis and real-time hemodynamic monitoring that captures output stability across physiological stress conditions. Our catheterization laboratories feature mock circulation loops replicating normal and failing heart hemodynamics while specialized test fixtures accommodate both implantable and percutaneous pump configurations. Hemocompatibility protocols quantify hemolysis indices, platelet activation markers, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 adapted for high-shear blood pump environments.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide chronic implantation assessment while device-specific protocols address pump durability through accelerated fatigue testing, flow dynamics optimization, and anatomical integration studies. Our GLP-compliant testing addresses PMA pathway requirements for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating next-generation LVADs, temporary support systems, or total artificial hearts, our protocols demonstrate both mechanical reliability and hemocompatibility performance that regulatory submissions demand.
capability_1_description: Pressure-flow curve validation across physiological ranges evaluates pump efficiency, power consumption, and flow stability under varying preload and afterload conditions while assessing continuous-flow dynamics and pulsatility characteristics
capability_2_description: Real-time monitoring captures cardiac output, ventricular pressure relationships, and systemic flow patterns using pressure-volume loop analysis that quantifies ventricular unloading and circulatory support effectiveness across stress conditions
capability_3_description: ISO 10993-4 compliant protocols quantify hemolysis indices, platelet function markers, and shear stress effects while evaluating thrombogenic potential and anticoagulation requirements for chronic blood-contacting pump surfaces
capability_4_description: Long-term durability protocols simulate years of continuous operation through accelerated cycling with performance monitoring detecting bearing wear, seal degradation, and motor stability changes across millions of pump cycles
capability_5_description: Advanced imaging identifies flow disturbances and stasis regions that promote thrombosis while computational fluid dynamics validation assesses shear stress distribution across blood-contacting surfaces and pump chambers
capability_6_description: Chronic implantation studies evaluate tissue response at pump interfaces, cannula positioning stability, and healing patterns using histopathological analysis with standardized scoring systems for fibrosis and inflammation assessment
why_choose_title: Why Choose Synchrony for Heart Pump Testing
why_choose_1_description: Two catheterization laboratories configured specifically for mechanical circulatory support evaluation feature continuous hemodynamic monitoring, pressure-volume loop analysis systems, and real-time flow measurement capabilities. Our mock circulation loops replicate physiological preload and afterload conditions while specialized test fixtures accommodate both implantable and percutaneous pump configurations. Accelerated durability testing systems simulate years of continuous operation through millions of pump cycles under controlled conditions.
why_choose_2_description: Founded by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered mechanical circulatory support techniques, our team understands pump physiology, ventricular mechanics, and hemodynamic optimization specific to life-sustaining devices. This cardiovascular heritage translates to protocol designs addressing FDA Class III requirements including durability demonstration, hemocompatibility validation, and the comprehensive safety evidence mechanical support devices demand for both bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy applications.
why_choose_3_description: Our data packages have supported successful FDA approvals for mechanical circulatory support devices across ventricular assist device, temporary support, and total artificial heart categories. We understand Class III life-sustaining device requirements including chronic biocompatibility demonstration through ISO 10993 compliance, pump durability validation, and the specific endpoints FDA expects for circulatory support submissions addressing both acute decompensation management and long-term cardiac replacement applications.
cta_description: Our team is ready to discuss your heart pump device, regulatory pathway, and study requirements to optimize your path to FDA approval.

hero_description: Comprehensive preclinical validation for left ventricular assist devices with hemocompatibility assessment under continuous flow conditions, pump durability protocols, driveline interface evaluation, and ventricular interaction analysis using GLP-compliant methodologies.
primary_content_description:
Left ventricular assist devices provide life-sustaining cardiac support, requiring validation that demonstrates pump reliability while preventing thrombosis, hemolysis, and infection complications throughout extended implantation periods. LVADs must maintain continuous flow supporting 5-6 liters per minute while preserving ventricular function and enabling potential cardiac recovery. Continuous-flow platforms demand specialized assessment of shear-induced blood damage while pump-ventricle interaction analysis ensures optimal hemodynamic support across varying cardiac function levels.

We evaluate LVAD performance using pressure-volume loop analysis and ventricular function monitoring that captures device-heart interaction throughout cardiac cycles. Our catheterization laboratories feature mock circulation systems replicating normal and failing heart conditions while specialized surgical models enable driveline tunneling assessment and percutaneous site evaluation. Hemocompatibility testing quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet activation, and von Willebrand factor degradation using ISO 10993-4 protocols adapted for chronic continuous-flow environments found in destination therapy applications.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide long-term implantation assessment while FDA guidance documents for ventricular assist devices inform protocol development addressing pump durability, electrical safety, and infection resistance requirements. Our GLP-compliant testing supports PMA pathways for Class III life-sustaining devices. Whether validating next-generation miniaturized LVADs, pediatric platforms, or destination therapy systems, our protocols demonstrate mechanical reliability, hemocompatibility performance, and driveline integrity that bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy indications demand.
capability_1_description: Pressure-volume loop characterization quantifies ventricular unloading, inflow cannula positioning effects, and outflow graft hemodynamics while assessing cardiac output augmentation and potential for myocardial recovery across heart failure severities
capability_2_description: ISO 10993-4 compliant testing adapted for continuous-flow devices quantifies hemolysis indices, platelet function changes, and von Willebrand factor degradation while evaluating thrombogenic potential under chronic anticoagulation scenarios typical of LVAD therapy
capability_3_description: Accelerated fatigue protocols simulate years of continuous operation through millions of pump cycles with performance monitoring detecting bearing wear, seal integrity changes, and motor efficiency degradation addressing destination therapy durability requirements
capability_4_description: Percutaneous exit site assessment evaluates tissue integration at skin-driveline interfaces while infection challenge studies characterize bacterial colonization resistance and biofilm formation potential across extended implantation periods
capability_5_description: Advanced flow visualization identifies stasis regions within pump chambers that promote thrombus formation while computational fluid dynamics validation assesses shear stress distribution affecting blood damage and platelet activation
capability_6_description: Electrical safety testing per IEC 60601 standards validates controller performance, battery longevity, and alarm system reliability while electromagnetic compatibility assessment ensures device operation across environmental conditions and medical equipment proximity
why_choose_title: Why Choose Synchrony for LVAD Testing

Our surgical suites enable driveline implantation studies and percutaneous site assessment while specialized test fixtures accommodate both intracorporeal and extracorporeal LVAD configurations. Accelerated durability systems simulate destination therapy requirements through millions of continuous pump cycles.
why_choose_2_description: Founded by Duke University interventional cardiologists who pioneered mechanical circulatory support therapies, our team understands ventricular mechanics, pump-heart interaction, and LVAD optimization specific to both bridge-to-transplant and destination therapy applications. This cardiovascular heritage translates to protocol designs addressing FDA Class III requirements including chronic hemocompatibility demonstration, pump durability validation, and the comprehensive safety evidence life-sustaining ventricular assist devices demand for extended support periods.
why_choose_3_description: Our data packages have supported successful FDA approvals for left ventricular assist devices across continuous-flow and pulsatile platforms. We understand Class III life-sustaining device requirements including chronic biocompatibility demonstration through ISO 10993 compliance, destination therapy durability validation, and the specific endpoints FDA expects for LVAD submissions addressing both bridge-to-transplant indications and permanent cardiac support applications requiring years of reliable operation.
cta_description: Our team is ready to discuss your LVAD device, regulatory pathway, and study requirements to optimize your path to FDA approval.
